en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 20

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is the excerpt from Thursday, October 20, 1865, in which two cases were discussed by the court, one involving Lewis Ross, brother of Chief John Ross. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 20 : page 1

body.value: Thursday 20th Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors John Martin &C et cetera Jurors G. George Saunders Fore Foreman On motion, it is ordered that the proceedings against Richard & John Ratliff , wherein Lewis Ross is as plaintiff against Richard & John Ratliff Dfts Defendants be stopped untill until further directed. It is the opinion of the Court that Richard Rowe shall hold the negroes that Sarah Hughes and others contended for, Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
